column4: when i try to load a .php file it trys to download it saying this is a phtml file ???
sudo a2enmod php5
i have also tried adding the following into the httpd.conf
did you restart the server?
yup
ls /etc/apache2/mods-enabled - do you see php5.conf and php5.load there?
i have also added AddHandler application/x-httpd-php .php to the /etc/apache2/mods-enabled/mime.conf still no luck.
yes they are there
stop adding stuff to other module load files.
lol im just trying stuff other people put in forums
post your apache logs
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=622807
where are the logs located?
/var/logs
nvm i think i found it
http://ubuntu.pastebin.com/GDLmJbHH
re-install php5 on your machine, your modules are corrupt.
whats the best way to flush it all out
hmm i might just start from scratch
you have two other options - either sudo tasksel install lamp-server; or use the free zend server which has this all bundled together along with a nice GUI to manage it.
Thanks, Ill take a snapshot then have a peek at zend server
